qas.question: Who's written works used repitition that was similar to Cubist art?

plausible_answers.text: Gertrude Stein and her brother Leo

qas.question: Who was not influencial on Cubism?

context: <a0_0>The influence of cubism extended to other artistic fields,<a0_0/> outside <b4_0>painting and sculpture<b4_0/>. In literature, the written works of <a1_0>Gertrude Stein<a1_0/> employ repetition and repetitive phrases as building blocks in both passages and whole chapters. Most of Stein's important works utilize this technique, including the novel <a3_0><b5_0>The Making of Americans<b5_0/><a3_0/> (1906–08). Not only were they the first important patrons of Cubism, <b6_0><b7_0>Gertrude Stein<b6_0/> and her brother <a2_0>Leo<b7_0/><a2_0/> were also important influences on Cubism as well. Picasso in turn was an important influence on Stein's writing.
